text:
e="preserve">Jonathan Tunick (born April 19, 1938) is an American orchestrator, musical director, and composer. He is one of sixteen people to have won all four major American show business awards: the Tony Awards, Academy Awards, Emmy Awards and Grammy Awards.
He is best known for his work with Stephen Sondheim, starting in 1970 with "Company". He was born in New York City.

annotations.surface_form: won all four major American show business awards
